thread.title: Gas pump warning stickers would warn of pollution, climate change
thread.title_full: Gas pump warning stickers would warn of pollution, climate change | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Gas pump warning stickers would warn of pollution, climate change
text:
If some Seattle City Council members have their way, drivers could see warning stickers every time they fill up.
Advocates say the pollution gas creates is as harmful as cigarettes.
In May, a group of students went to the City Council to push for warning covers on gas pump handles reminding drivers that car exhaust causes pollution and leads to climate change.
The covers would be similar to what Berkeley and San Francisco have in California.
The Seattle Times reports that eight Seattle council members have signed a letter to San Francisco leaders applauding their efforts and indicating council member Mike O’Brien’s plans to try to get legislation passed in Seattle as well.
The Times reports that council member Tom Rasmussen was the only council member who didn’t sign the letter and does not appear to support the plan.
"I would imagine that we would get a lot of opposition from the oil companies and probably would have to go to court,” said Rasmussen.
When KIRO 7’s Nick McGurk spoke to Berkeley leaders, they acknowledged they could get sued by oil companies.
